alert.note: Alert for Haskell (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 08 at 7:36AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Oklahoma, northeast Oklahoma and southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Muskogee. In northeast Oklahoma, Okmulgee. In southeast Oklahoma, Haskell, Latimer, Le Flore, McIntosh and Pittsburg. * WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 733 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and scattered thunderstorms ongoing across east central and southeast Oklahoma. The heaviest rains have ended however moderate to occasional heavy rain will continue through the morning and combine with the overnight heavy rains to produce flooded areas. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen through early this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Poteau... Wilburton... Eufaula... Stigler... Henryetta... Heavener... Checotah... Spiro... Panama... Wister... Quinton... Dewar... Howe... Porum... Keota... Red Oak... Mccurtain... Bokoshe... Schulter... Crowder... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
